intro: Arracacia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's arracacha, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Its roots are edible and have a slightly spicy flavor, similar to that of celery root. Due to its ornamental value and culinary potential, it is cultivated in some regions for both garden display and local food use.
